title:
Collisionless tearing instability in a relativistic pair plasma with a
  power-law distribution function
abstract:
We study the tearing instability of a current sheet in a relativistic pair
plasma with a power law distribution function. We first estimate the growth
rate analytically and then confirm the analytical results by solving
numerically the dispersion equation, taking into account all exact particle
trajectories within the reconnecting layer. We found that the instability is
suppressed when the particle spectrum becomes harder.
